newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hoechst starts diagnostics joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Hoechst starts diagnostics joint venture.

text.p: German chemical and pharmaceuticals group Hoechst AG said on Wednesday it planned to enter a joint venture with U.S. group Dade International for its diagnostics business.
Hoechst chief executive Juergen Dormann said Hoechst would hold a 32 percent minority stake in the venture, which will be called Dade Behring.
A future bourse listing is planned for the new venture but Hoechst did not say in a statement at its annual news conference on which bourse the group would be listed.
Hoechst's diagnostics business, Behring Diagnostics, had been under pressure in recent years but swung to an 88 million mark profit in 1996.
The new joint venture will post annual sales of around 2.3 billion marks and will become one of the largest diagnostics groups.
